body: The participation of a large number of combatants increases the difficulty of swaying the crowd. Large groups of combatants make it difficult for a crowd to follow the entire battle and to catch actions from individuals that could possibly sway the audience's attitude. Adjust these modifications as combatants enter or leave the battle.
name: Total Number of Combatants
url: pfsrd://Ultimate Combat/Rules/Mastering Combat/Performance Combat/Performance Combat Check DC/Total Number of Combatants

sections.body: If the battle is between a total of 2–8 combatants, there is no change to the base DC to improve the attitude of the crowd or gain victory points.
sections.name: Small Battle
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Combat/Rules/Mastering Combat/Performance Combat/Performance Combat Check DC/Total Number of Combatants/Small Battle

sections.body: If the battle is between 9–16 combatants, the DC to improve the attitude of the crowd or gain victory points increases by +4.
sections.name: Medium Battle
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Combat/Rules/Mastering Combat/Performance Combat/Performance Combat Check DC/Total Number of Combatants/Medium Battle

sections.body: A battle with 17 or more total combatants increases the DC to improve the attitude of the crowd by +8.
sections.name: Large Battle
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Combat/Rules/Mastering Combat/Performance Combat/Performance Combat Check DC/Total Number of Combatants/Large Battle
